problem: How much work is required to stop an electron moving at a speed of 1.40 × 10⁶ m/s? (Given: mass of electron m = 9.11 × 10⁻³¹ kg)

correctFormulas.name: Change in kinetic energy
correctFormulas.formula: W = ΔK = ½ mₑ (0² − vᵢ²) = −½ mₑ vᵢ²

steps.explanation: The required work equals the negative of the initial kinetic energy.
